text: Brilliant by @conor64

author: edwardlucas

text: When I say "right to exist" i mean that I don't agree with this http://kayhan.ir/en/news/52905/countdown-for-west-asia-without-the-illegal-zionist-entity …  which seems to advocate forcible repatriation of Jews/elimination of Israel, which I can see might make Israelis a bit nervous.
author: edwardlucas

text: you know a great deal about Israel and I don't. I would be interested to know in your view whether you see any prospect for a peaceful compromise and what the (pre-)conditions would be for that, on both/all sides.
author: edwardlucas

text: please give examples of thriving Jewish communities in Syria, Lebanon, Egypt, Iraq, Iran etc. I may be wrong but my impression is that the vast majority emigrated to Israel , in the face of severe persecution.
author: edwardlucas

text: there's plenty of blame to go round but I think you have to start by agreeing that neither side is innocent. The question is how you get to peace, not getting your adversary to accept your version of history
author: edwardlucas

text: I'm glad you think a compromise is desirable and achievable. Let's discuss what concessions both sides should make in pursuit of that compromise. How about mutual recognition and ceasefire?
author: edwardlucas

text: given what has happened to Jews in literally every Arab/Muslim country in the region, I assume you are not suggesting that they stay living under majority-Arab rule.
author: edwardlucas

text: I don't accept any comparison with South Africa -- indeed i vehemently reject it. My question is what happens to the Jews after you abolish Israel.
author: edwardlucas

text: You don't accept that this is a complex issue on which sincere, differing views are possible?
author: edwardlucas

text: I am clear that you think that israel is a racist state and like South Africa. Do you think that Jewish Israelis should go "back" to where they or their forbears came from, or would they be allowed to continue living as a minority in some putative binational state?
author: edwardlucas

text: I don't see how you are going to get peace when you insist on describing one party (which happens to be the only democracy in the region) as "racist and colonialist" and give a free pass to the huge abuses that happen in all neighbouring countries and entities.
author: edwardlucas

text: Please try to stay polite.
author: edwardlucas

text: so you accept Israel's right to exist (ie as a Jewish state) but only within 1967 borders?
author: edwardlucas

text: and if you are Israeli, then "right to exist" is not "crap". I think it is a good idea to avoid dehumanising and pejorative language
author: edwardlucas

text: I am sorry if I have misunderstood you. But I am trying to find out whether you think Israel has the right to exist. You simultaneously say you do not wish to eliminate it, but that Palestinians (accepting your terminology for the moment) have unconditional right of return.
author: edwardlucas

text: So do you believe in Israel’s right to exist? If not then obliteration looms
author: edwardlucas

text: so you are in favour of Israel's continued existence, eg as part two-state solution -- or you want a single-state solution with full right of return, which would be obliteration?
author: edwardlucas

text: I thought you said Israel was a racist state — sorry if I misunderstood
author: edwardlucas

text: I do not believe in the obliteration of the state of Israel, though I get the impression that you do. So we are unlikely to reach agreement. Debate is not just hammering your opponent into the ground -- it's respectful engagement. I'm up for it. Are you?
author: edwardlucas

text: I don’t claim to be an authority on Israel or the Middle East. I was asked a question and tried to answer it.  I respect your point of view and I realise this is a contentious topic. How about approaching it in a spirit of mutual respect?
author: edwardlucas

text: I have the impression that only total agreement will satisfy you. Can’t you accept that there are different views on complex issues which are sincerely held?
author: edwardlucas

text: You are conflating Israeli arabs and Palestinians
author: edwardlucas

text: If Arab-Israelis were treated like blacks in s Africa. But they are not. They vote. They sue. They run businesses.  Access to education at all levels. Live where they want.
author: edwardlucas

text: I don't think the Estonians can be blamed for designing the internet. The 2007 cyberattack came exactly at the time when Russia was exerting extraordinary diplomatic and other pressure in protest at the moving of a statue. Estonia successfully defended itself.

text: For most of the last 30 years my take on Russia (and before that USSR) has been unpopular. Which hasn’t bothered me in the slightest. Many people have got very rich on the Kremlin gravy train.
